column1: Wishing a happy birthday to @Kilili_Sablan a proud Member from the Northern Mariana Islands. Thank you for fighting #ForThePeople in the Mariana Islands and working to provide funding for disaster recovery efforts.

Happy birthday to @RepSherrill of #NJ11. We’re grateful for your service to this country in the Navy & for your work to strengthen national security & defend America abroad. I also applaud your tremendous work on the SALT bill passed last year to ensure tax fairness for Americans

Martin Luther King Jr. urged us to promote love inclusion acceptance and the best of values that bring us together as a people. As we observe #MLK day and King’s legacy this weekend I encourage every American to live out the lessons he shared with us during his lifetime. https://t.co/EYh5511Nfm

As a founding member of the Black Maternal Health Caucus I’m committed to closing disparities in health care. The GOP #ACA lawsuit would undo the work the ACA did to expand care for people of color. This is unacceptable & I will continue to stand against it. #ProtectOurCare

I hope my friend @RepDMP enjoys her birthday today. Thank you for working hard to fix our broken immigration system including protecting Dreamers and our asylum process and for your commitment to #EndGunViolence.

Dems want to strengthen the #ACA and #ProtectOurCare so that more people can receive the care they need. The GOP is attempting to dismantle it in court and if successful that would limit the ability of Americans’ to get health coverage.

This week House Dems:  ✅ Voted to protect older workers against discrimination  ✅ Voted to defend students who have been denied debt relief by the Administration ✅ Continued to call on the Senate to take up our govt reform legislation #ForThePeople https://t.co/G4EKUYAZe0

Ahead of the 10th anniversary of Citizens United I joined @RepSarbanes End Citizens United Action Fund & community leaders in Hyattsville to discuss the disastrous decision & work House Dems are doing to restore the power of the people’s vote. https://t.co/nj7dd2RBkU https://t.co/fvU9ZhEnuS

Yesterday MD Attorney General @BrianFrosh & 13 other states filed a lawsuit against the Trump Admin’s effort to slash nutrition assistance. We won’t sit back while the Administration advances its plan to cut this critical assistance for families. https://t.co/l4PagmgsvH

I’m at the Hyattsville City Hall today with leaders from End Citizens United and my colleague @RepSarbanes discussing the urgent fight for government reforms 10 years after #CitizensUnited. Tune in live @CSPAN Channel 2.
Thank you @AyannaPressley for your courage in sharing your story. Your authenticity is one of the many things that make you such a valuable addition to our Caucus. https://t.co/we9t3rGyLM

I’m glad POTUS finally signed a major disaster for #PuertoRico but it should not have taken this long. I urge that POTUS do everything in his power to help Puerto Rico emerge from these recent natural disasters stronger than before. https://t.co/F79Rdx05xZ

Proud to receive an “A” score from End Citizens United Action Fund for my efforts to strengthen our democracy & reform govt to make it work for the people it serves. I’ll continue to work with my colleagues to make govt more accountable & transparent. https://t.co/qkbWByl650 https://t.co/7jcuE8A9bq

If the GOP's #ACA lawsuit succeeds rural areas will be left behind. The ACA’s Medicaid expansion has helped keep many rural hospitals open and the law has also provided critical resources to combat the opioid crisis. I’ll continue to fight to defend the ACA and #ProtectOurCare.

The Trump Admin is working to deny relief to student borrowers who were defrauded by predatory schools. Today the House voted to #StandWithStudents & ensure debt relief is not blocked for those who should receive it. I thank @EdLaborCmte & @RepSusieLee for working on this issue. https://t.co/UAREvkm9zJ

When the House passed the articles of impeachment against POTUS I urged my colleagues to summon the courage to #DefendOurDemocracy.   Having taken their oath I urge each senator to summon the courage to honor their oaths to "do impartial justice" to set country above party. https://t.co/UdDnmxVdQ3

I urge senators to take seriously their oath to act impartially in judging whether this president has abused the power of his office by placing his own personal and political interests ahead of the nation’s and obstructing Congress in order to cover it up.

GAO’s confirmation that POTUS violated the law the admission by Lev Parnas last night & the release of new documents add to the growing body of evidence that for this president the law holds no power the Constitution has no weight. https://t.co/KS5qXKgAnq

No American should face discrimination in the workplace. I was proud to bring #HR1230 to the House Floor yesterday to #ProtectOlderWorkers in #MD and across the country from age discrimination. I urge Senator McConnell to take up this important legislation. https://t.co/PRbvWKHHaB

When we return from the district work period the House will vote on an emergency supplemental for #PuertoRico to provide assistance as the island recovers from earthquakes. House Dems are proud to stand with #OurFellowAmericans & help them recover & rebuild stronger than before.

Disappointed to hear that the Prince George's Sentinel will publish its final paper on Jan. 30. For decades the dedicated staff has reported on the issues that matter to our community. I thank them for the work they have done to inform Marylanders. https://t.co/fD5lqtfi2I

I congratulate Virginia state lawmakers on passage of the Equal Rights Amendment. I strongly support legislation in the House and I am working with the House Judiciary Committee to bring it to the Floor for a vote soon.

The last decade has been the hottest ever & this #ClimateCrisis deserves urgent action. Dems have held over 120 hearings & passed the #ClimateActionNow Act & additional legislation to respond. I look fwd to working on additional bills to #ActOnClimate. https://t.co/3ru95uQAwx

While the GOP is working to strike down the #ACA and force seniors to pay more for their prescription drugs House Democrats are working to bring down Rx drug prices. We passed the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act last month and continue to call on the GOP-led Senate to take it up. https://t.co/CTxLNxxBdB

Proud the House passed the Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act today with bipartisan support to ensure that victims of age discrimination in the workplace can enforce their rights. I hope the Senate will take up and pass this bipartisan bill #ForThePeople. #POWADA https://t.co/ZvN1EtOmTc

House Dems will also continue to call on the President to approve the Governor’s request for a major disaster declaration following the recent earthquakes. I urge the President to end his foot dragging and help our fellow Americans immediately.

While POTUS released some of the aid Congress appropriated for #PuertoRico much remains in limbo. Dems will continue to work to ensure all appropriated funds reach #OurFellowAmericans & that the Administration’s barriers do not further delay funds. https://t.co/LcbZDaC1Ub

Hate-based violence should not be tolerated in this country & the rise in anti-Semitic violence should alarm all of us. I appreciate that @HomelandDems are holding a hearing on this issue today. We are united in condemning anti-Semitism. https://t.co/sLMo7MT0px

The evidence that was released last night was disturbing and is consistent with what we know: POTUS abused the power of his office to benefit himself politically. The American people deserve a fair impartial trial in the Senate & the Senate should demand all relevant documents.

Today the House passed a resolution to name impeachment managers & transmit articles. I trust each of the appointed managers will continue to #DefendOurDemocracy.   The Senate now has a choice to honor their oath to do “impartial justice” or continue the #TrumpCoverup.

House Dems are focused on the urgent threat posed by the climate crisis. I thank @HouseScience for bringing in experts today to discuss the urgency of #ClimateActionNow. We will continue to work together to #ActOnClimate. https://t.co/HPtrsSzWzI

The federal government must work with state and local governments to serve the American people. Thanks to @HouseBudgetDems for its hearing to examine how the federal budget affects the operations of state and local governments. https://t.co/gQR2gwpIhu

I thank @HouseSmallBiz for holding a hearing today on expanding patent diversity so that more Americans including women minorities and veterans have access to patent protection. Innovation is critical to ensuring more of our people can #MakeItInAmerica. https://t.co/RFgB72xIm2

Glad to welcome @AACoFD Chief Trisha Wolford to Capitol Hill. As Chair of the Congressional Fire Services Caucus I’m very focused on ensuring fire departments have the resources they need. I look forward to working with Chief Wolford & thank her for her leadership in #MD05. https://t.co/5NIsvZTX2n

Despite what @POTUS has claimed he has taken steps to undermine protections for those with pre-ex conditions. Dems have passed legislation to protect those w pre-ex conditions & lower health care costs & we’ll continue to fight to #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/JTDpjURZDY

We cannot ignore the housing crisis in this country. I commend @FSCDems for holding a hearing today on solutions to address this issue and ensure more families in America can access affordable safe housing. https://t.co/3geKReoKZY

10 years after #CitizensUnited House Dems are calling on @senatemajldr to allow a vote on #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act. The bill would undo the worst effects of  Citizens United and make America more open democratic free and responsive to its citizens. https://t.co/nGFA6SwXPs https://t.co/rIewhbutzA

Prior to the #ACA women were often charged more than men for the same coverage. With their partisan lawsuit President Trump and Congressional Republicans are attempting to turn back the clock. RT if you agree we must #ProtectOurCare.

If the GOP succeeds in striking down the #ACA through its partisan lawsuit 2.3 million young people under the age of 26 will no longer be able to stay on their parents’ insurance. That’s unacceptable & House Dems will continue to oppose this effort and work to #ProtectOurCare.

I appreciate hearing about the issues that matter most to my constituents & I will keep fighting in Congress to make their voices heard. If you couldn’t join us last night please visit https://t.co/TC2Lf3c0iq to learn more about the work I’m doing in Washington on your behalf.

Thank you to #MD05 constituents who participated in my telephone town hall last night. We spoke about a wide range of issues including action Dems are taking to tackle climate change lower health care and prescription drug prices & protect our communities from gun violence. https://t.co/njO7O6FPqd

I thank @RepBarbaraLee @RepRoKhanna & @USProgressives for working closely with the House Democratic leadership to ensure the broadest possible support for bills introduced by Reps. Lee and Khanna to reassert Congress’s constitutional authority in questions of war and peace.

The week of Jan. 27 the House will consider bills introduced by @RepBarbaraLee & @RepRoKhanna to repeal the 2002 AUMF and prevent taxpayer $ from being used to take military action against Iran without congressional authorization respectively. https://t.co/yfJUgdQIX8

.@EnergyCommerce Democrats have continued to lead efforts to address the opioid crisis. I thank the Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations for holding a hearing this morning to examine this public health crisis and effective measures to combat it. https://t.co/uCD5cih7NE

This month will mark 10 years since the #CitizensUnited decision which has allowed dark money to drown out the will of the people. House Dems continue to call on the Senate to take up the #ForThePeople Act which will reform our campaign finance system. https://t.co/HtulmUDol4

Lastly I reminded reporters that next week marks 10 years since the Citizens United SCOTUS decision. The House passed a comprehensive government reform package & we will continue to pressure the Senate to take up #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act.

I spoke on the state of our economy at my weekly press conf and how Dems are working to ensure more Americans get ahead. We will continue to pass legislation to rebuild our infrastructure strengthen #ACA and make higher ed more affordable.

I also told reporters that the House is passing important legislation from @EdLaborCmte this week to protect older workers from discrimination and students who have been defrauded by their educational institutions. I urge the GOP to support these bills.

Today at my weekly press conference I told reporters that House Democrats will be transmitting articles of impeachment to the Senate this week. The American people expect & deserve a fair trial & I hope that the Republican Senate takes this matter seriously as impartial jurors.

Great to see the Maryland Senate unveil portraits of Senate President Emeritus Mike Miller and the late Sen. Verda Welcome in the chamber. As a former Senate President myself these portraits are a touching tribute to the service of both Senators on behalf of the people of MD. https://t.co/A4yTAdUfII

I congratulate @iingwen on her re-election and applaud the Taiwanese people on their proud demonstration of democracy. I stand with Taiwan in their fight for freedom democracy and independence in the face of Chinese efforts to undermine these principles.

Exciting things are happening at @NASAGoddard! Congrats to Wolf & the team in Greenbelt on the discovery of new planet TOI 1338 b. I’m proud of the outstanding discoveries happening at NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center. https://t.co/gPNr8p32ez

House Dems are continuing to take action #ForThePeople. Last week we passed the #PFAS Action Act to address the harmful impact of toxic PFAS chemicals in communities throughout the country. RT if you agree Congress should act quickly on PFAS to protect consumers. https://t.co/fwWW8ZkQtt

Happy birthday to my friend @JacksonLeeTX18. Thank you for your dedication to reforming our criminal justice system as a member of @HouseJudiciary and for your work on immigration and transportation policy on @HomelandDems.

The Administration is attempting to rollback the #ACA’s protections including provisions that prohibit discrimination against #LGBTQ Americans in health care. House Dems will continue to defend the law and its protections. RT if you stand with us.

Millions of seniors saved on prescription drugs since the enactment of the #ACA. Rather than work to strengthen the law the GOP is attempting to strike it down with their partisan lawsuit. Dems will continue to defend the law & work to lower health care costs. #ProtectOurCare

This week House Democrats: ✅Took action regarding Iran ✅Voted for the #PFAS Action Act to protect Americans from toxic chemicals    ✅ Continue to focus on job creation expanding opportunity and ensuring more people can #MakeitinAmerica. https://t.co/UTDENKqfxi

In 2020 we will continue to build on these actions by pushing for investments in infrastructure that create jobs and help more of our workers #MakeItInAmerica. We will not rest as we work to make sure government & our economy always work #ForThePeople.

That’s why in 2019 we passed major legislation to #RaiseTheWage ensure #EqualPay #LowerDrugCosts and help more workers save for a secure retirement and protect multi-employer pension funds from going insolvent.

House Dems believe that the answer to solving economic challenges in the decade to come is to ensure that our government works for those it serves making opportunities more accessible while helping entrepreneurs and businesses create good jobs that pay well.

POTUS will claim credit for a strong economy but this month’s #JobsReport caps a year that ranks a 8th in the 2010’s for job creation. Wage growth has slowed manufacturing is contracting & affording higher ed or a secure retirement is more challenging. https://t.co/pZYoW8ZY4b

Communities are dealing with serious public health challenges due to #PFAS contamination. Today I voted to: ✅Ensure contaminated sites are cleaned up ✅Limit the intro of new PFAS chemicals ✅Establish a drinking water standard ✅Provide assistance to treat PFAS contamination https://t.co/A2ugrwLPKL
I applaud the work of @RepDebDingell @FrankPallone @RepPaulTonko and @RepPeterDeFazio on the PFAS Action Act a comprehensive bill to address this issue and look forward to its passage this morning.

PFAS contaminants known as forever chemicals pose a real threat to public health in communities across the country. Too many Americans have experienced the harmful side effects of these chemicals and they cannot wait any longer for action. https://t.co/QX6fCJq9r4

The GOP has been trying to sabotage Americans’ health care for years. If they win their #ACA lawsuit they would eliminate protections for children seniors & those with disabilities. Dems will continue fighting #ForThePeople & to #ProtectOurCare. https://t.co/gh7HWl9lUz

Congress took steps to address PFAS contamination through passage of the defense bill last month but that action alone is not enough. That's why the House is passing a comprehensive bipartisan bill to address PFAS & protect consumers from these "forever chemicals" this week. https://t.co/ERJ4Y6u8O6

The House is beginning debate of the PFAS Action Act comprehensive legislation that responds to the urgent public health threat posed by PFAS chemicals.   Learn more about how this bill will address PFAS contamination and protect American consumers here: https://t.co/WX3kK7ASaM https://t.co/VYLp8QPmK0

Today the House passed a war powers resolution to limit the President’s military actions regarding Iran. We must have a sound long-term strategy to deal with Iran. The best way forward is for Congress and the Administration to work together. https://t.co/tUPK6DKEeB

A fair and accurate Census is key to ensuring communities receive resources like funding for education and public health. We must ensure everyone is counted. I thank the @OversightDems for leading on this issue & examining strategies for reaching hard-to-count communities. https://t.co/IQH6zBD38Y

House Democrats are proud to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with working men and women across the country. I look forward to bringing the PRO Act to the House Floor for a vote prior to the President's Day district work period to protect the right to organize and bargain collectively.

If @POTUS was serious about rebuilding infrastructure he wouldn’t have walked out on negotiations months ago. Instead of working with Congress on infrastructure he’s cutting the voices of the people from the #NEPA process & ignoring the #ClimateCrisis. https://t.co/2TmQj9im2Q

Even after devastating earthquakes the Admin is illegally withholding billions of dollars in aid to #PuertoRico. Congress approved this funding on a bipartisan basis & I call on the full release of aid now to help #OurFellowAmericans recover & rebuild. https://t.co/WE5hff9tTG

Rural communities around the country can benefit from agriculture technology that increases production efficiency and promotes job creation. I thank the @HouseSmallBiz for its hearing this morning to highlight how farmers around the country can widely benefit from ag-tech. https://t.co/yiCFuwSLz6

With their #ACA lawsuit the GOP is trying to return to a time when Americans could be denied coverage due to pre-ex conditions. Since day one of our majority House Dems have taken action to protect those w pre-ex conditions & ensure they won’t lose coverage. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/N2wG9KWLWs

As a new session of the MD General Assembly begins I look forward to the work my colleagues in Annapolis will do under the leadership of @SpeakerAJones & Senate Pres. Bill Ferguson. I hope this Session will be one of great progress. #MDGA20 #Working4MD https://t.co/Yzyv9m1TOD

Proud that @EnergyCommerce under @FrankPallone’s leadership is pursuing a bold legislative framework to achieve 100% clean energy by 2050. House Dems have passed legislation to #ActOnClimate & we will continue to work to address the #ClimateCrisis w the seriousness it deserves. https://t.co/m6Jcg7thIB

Tomorrow I will bring @RepSlotkin’s war powers resolution to the Floor to limit @POTUS's military actions regarding Iran. The Admin must articulate a clear long-term strategy to deescalate tensions with Iran & promote stability in the region. It has failed to do so to date.

Two years after the devastating Hurricanes Irma and Maria most of the disaster aid for #PuertoRico has yet to be released by the Admin. As we respond to the new damage wrought by earthquakes I urge the release of funding to help Puerto Rico rebuild. https://t.co/dLxhs2Tlg7

I thank Kenneth Mendez President & CEO of @AAFANational for providing testimony at today’s @EnergyCommerce hearing on how my bipartisan bill the School-Based Allergies & Asthma Management Program Act would help students w these chronic conditions focus on their education.

Asthma and allergies are major factors in school absenteeism which is why I introduced a bipartisan bill with @DrPhilRoe to encourage schools to help students manage these conditions. I am pleased @EnergyCommerce is holding a hearing on it & 6 bills to improve health outcomes. https://t.co/zOeTTivMq2

I also told press that we will continue to work #ForThePeople this month including passing the PFAS Action Act bills regarding the expansion of 5G a resolution to help protect student loan borrowers & a bill to address discrimination against older workers.

I reminded press the Dem Majority not only fully funded the govt in 2019 but also passed legislation to #LowerDrugCosts #RaiseTheWage #ActOnClimate #ProtectTheDream & more. I continue to urge @senatemajldr to consider 275 bipartisan House-passed bills pending in the Senate.

At my weekly press conference this morning I told reporters there are a number of questions that the Administration needs to answer at today’s briefing on Iran including what the long-term strategy is to deescalate tensions with Iran and promote stability in the region.
Read my full statement on Iran’s attack against Iraq and U.S. troops here: https://t.co/jIFtB7GSoK https://t.co/bxhDVOYIL8

If Republicans succeed in striking down critical #ACA protections through their partisan lawsuit 17 million people enrolled through the Medicaid expansion could lose coverage. Dems will continue fighting to #ProtectOurCare. Read more about the impact: https://t.co/jAdhRFjx9D

My thoughts are with the people of #PuertoRico in the aftermath of the recent earthquakes. The Congress stands ready to assist #OurFellowAmericans and I urge the Administration to ensure the necessary resources are in place to address power outages as swiftly as possible.

A fair and accurate 2020 Census is critically important to #MD05 especially historically undercounted communities. I was glad to meet with Complete Count Committees & Census Officials today to learn more about their work to ensure everyone is counted. https://t.co/yNS1avlFc6 https://t.co/uBjGdAopTl

These reports are deeply troubling. Improving the health of the Chesapeake Bay & addressing pollution is critically important to public health and the economic well-being of MD. The @EPA must lead on this issue – not retreat from its responsibility. https://t.co/sDLxKsZa3I

Great to join business & community leaders in Clinton today at the Greater Prince George’s Business Roundtable’s annual meeting. I’m proud to work with them to grow jobs in our County & expand economic opportunity in #MD05. https://t.co/tJLAt4j0fO https://t.co/Da6UQjJPiM
Wishing a happy birthday to my friend from #TX33 @RepVeasey. Thanks for leading @BlueCollarDems and for your commitment to ensuring more working families can get ahead and #MakeItInAmerica.

Happy birthday to new Member @RepKatiePorter. Thanks for using your background in consumer protection to fight #ForThePeople on @FSCDems & for leading the way to repeal the SALT deduction cap for your Orange County constituents. I look fwd to having your voice on @OversightDems.
Read my full statement on last night’s airstrike in Iraq here: https://t.co/hC8dfFKNAI https://t.co/aNxikMBl0m
Happy birthday to my dear friend and colleague @RepTerriSewell. Thanks for your dedication and work to #RestoreTheVote for all Americans.

Wishing a happy birthday to @RepDerekKilmer of #WA06. I thank you for your work as Chair of the @ModernizeCmte and for pushing for smart reforms to ensure Congress works better for Members staff and #ForThePeople.
Happy New Year to all! I wish every American a prosperous year ahead. https://t.co/1GYJZuhoiP

It is my honor to serve the people of #MD05 and 2019 was another busy year meeting with constituents working to ensure government works for them and passing legislation #ForThePeople. If my office can be of assistance in the new year please reach out: https://t.co/WAhxQITWj8 https://t.co/Dbx3ONjb4v

I was shocked & saddened by the anti-Semitic attack in New York - & alarmed by the rise in hateful attacks against Jews. Nothing can ever justify anti-Semitism or any vile acts of racist violence. We must all come together as one nation in condemning them. https://t.co/Kq0Qq0NPhG

.@RepJohnLewis is an American hero and beloved by this nation. Just as he has fought injustice I know he will battle this illness with courage strength and determination. I pray for his swift recovery & that he will soon be back to #goodtrouble. https://t.co/Owt3U7Fuk8
Happy birthday to new Member @RepFinkenauer. The Caucus is grateful for your leadership as Chair of the @HouseSmallBiz Rural Development Agriculture Trade and Entrepreneurship Subcommittee.
Happy Kwanzaa and week of celebration to those in #MD05 and across the country! https://t.co/0tk6E9ggBU
I join in wishing all a merry Christmas today full of warmth and good cheer. https://t.co/BY3aufEtyU
Happy birthday to my friend @daveloebsack of #IA02. Thank you for all you do for hardworking Iowans on  @EnergyCommerce @HASCDemocrats and @EdLaborCmte.
Wishing all those who celebrate the Festival of Lights in #MD05 and across the country a #HappyHanukkah. https://t.co/b300juqsUC

Wishing a happy birthday to my friend @RepZoeLofgren. I am grateful for your tireless leadership to protect #Dreamers and reform our broken immigration system as Chair of @HouseJudiciary Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

This week House Democrats:  ✅ Voted to uphold our oaths to defend the Constitution ✅ Funded the government and prevented a harmful shutdown  ✅ Passed #USMCA a better trade agreement for American workers.   https://t.co/XU158R7Rya

Two years ago House Democrats said the #GOPTaxScam would benefit the wealthy at the expense of the middle class. Today it is doing exactly what we predicted: benefiting the wealthy and large corporations while exploding the deficit and leaving workers behind. https://t.co/n96ulzeYpx

Excited to announce Patuxent HS student Matthew Hunter won this year’s #MD05 @CongressionalAC with “The Art of Cryptology.” Congrats to every student who participated. I was impressed by the creativity & dedication displayed. View the full list of winners: https://t.co/xwZmjulmJv

As a member of the Bipartisan HBCU Caucus I'm pleased that the #FUTUREAct was signed into law today for students in my district & around the country. HBCUs and MSIs can now benefit from permanent funding. I thank Rep. Adams for her leadership on this issue. https://t.co/Fv2CBFCXAC

Last week House Democrats passed #HR3 the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act. Across the country Members are discussing passage of the bill and how it will bring down the price of prescription drugs #ForThePeople. See what they are saying: https://t.co/Pc5vepvDfW

The Senate has passed the overwhelmingly bipartisan #TRACED Act to crack down on robocalls. Americans around the country are sick and tired of these calls and it is great news that both chambers have now passed the legislation and it is headed to the President’s desk.

#USMCA is a vast improvement over the President’s draft. Dems secured changes to ensure that its enforcement mechanisms are stronger it protects American workers & it will help lower Rx drug costs. This is truly the product of bipartisanship with many victories #ForThePeople. https://t.co/2eKF4eRdoI

Yesterday Democrats showed extraordinary courage and put duty to country and the Constitution first.   In addition to our work to #DefendOurDemocracy we have also passed legislation #ForThePeople. I continue to call on Senator McConnell to take up House-passed legislation. https://t.co/HGFwqTK7pl

The guilty verdict in the murder trial of 2nd Lt. Richard Collins III won’t bring him back but I hope it provides some relief to his loved ones. My thoughts continue to be w the Collins family & I join in remembering his positive impact on his community. https://t.co/nUQiTk7MPC

That’s what yesterday’s vote was about: patriotism and duty to country.   I hope the Senate will take their duty to serve as impartial jurors seriously. Our democracy depends on it. https://t.co/C7BbDU0KmF

John Dingell was a great American who made a profound impact on our nation.   Debbie the love & devotion you shared is an example to us all. While this President seeks to divide and hurt let us lift up that love & remember the wonderful legacy of such a good & decent man.

Disappointed by today’s 5th Circuit court ruling on the #ACA. House Dems will continue to do everything in our power to ensure that the law can keep providing Americans with access to quality affordable health coverage.  https://t.co/aELouzepgt

I urge my colleagues: look into your soul.   Summon the courage to #DefendOurDemocracy.  With our votes we can “bear true faith and allegiance” to the vision of our Founders.  And we can show future generations what it truly means to be “Americans first.” (4/4) https://t.co/jCvvRWsQTa

We have seen Republican courage throughout our history from the Civil War to the Cold War.   We need not ask who will be the first to show courage by standing up to President Trump.  The question we must now ask is: who will be the last to find it?  (3/4) https://t.co/k1fw7IqobE

No one is above the law – even a president. Especially a president. If the House does not act we run the risk of allowing the President’s misconduct to be repeated at the expense of our elections national security and our Constitution. (2/4) https://t.co/coFD2mVxuw

These two articles before us concern two profound Constitutional issues. First whether it is acceptable for POTUS to solicit foreign interference in our elections. And second whether it is permissible for POTUS to obstruct Congress and act as if he is above the law. (1/4) https://t.co/tTnuNEuSu1

When Democrats saw our national security and the integrity of our elections being undermined by this President it was then and only then that we came to the conclusion that we must act to #DefendOurDemocracy. https://t.co/qbSqQrZMAm

When we are asked to #DefendOurDemocracy loyalty to party must yield to a higher obligation.   There is still a chance for the GOP to summon the courage this moment demands. Not to do so would diminish our democracy & imperil the future of our republic. https://t.co/5cUztd9rYO

House Democrats are compelled by our duty to uphold our oath to defend the Constitution and our democracy. This is not a day for celebration; this is not a day for claiming victory. This is a day for doing our responsibility. #DefendOurDemocracy https://t.co/9ea7hQldqY

It’s a sad day for the country as the House considers articles of impeachment against the President. He has abused his power and held himself above the law leaving the House no choice but to act. Either we will #DefendOurDemocracy or we won’t. That’s what today is about. https://t.co/0FU9wi59Os

Legislation to fund the govt delivers many significant wins for #MD05 families:   ✅3.1% pay adjustment for federal employees ✅funding for #ChesapeakeBay & tributaries ✅strengthens early childhood education ✅funding for @NASAGoddard   Learn more here: https://t.co/RlwAi6pbl0

Tomorrow’s impeachment vote is not about politics; it’s not about polls; it's not about whether one gets re-elected or not. It is about upholding our oath of office. And while House Dems #DefendOurDemocracy we are also doing the people’s business and ensuring the govt is funded. https://t.co/7m7iimfgFn

I am so proud of the 4 extraordinary #HBCUs in MD & I was pleased to celebrate House and Senate passage of the #FUTUREAct today which will strengthen HBCUs and MSIs across the country. I thank @RepAdams for championing HBCUs and her leadership on the bill. https://t.co/VFkou4mR0Z

Happy birthday to my friend and a fighter for all in #NJ10 @RepDonaldPayne. Thank you for defending the #ACA advocating for children’s health care and raising awareness on the importance of cancer screenings. I'm pleased your cancer screenings provision was included in #HR3.

New funding for the Purple Line brings us one step closer to making this project a reality and ensuring safe and reliable transportation for MD commuters including thousands of federal employees. https://t.co/bqFJIGg1y5

I thank @HouseIntel for their work today. It was a critical day in this impeachment inquiry and our efforts to pursue the truth for the American people and #DefendOurDemocracy.

Witnesses we heard from this evening also explained to the public why it matters that aid was withheld and what’s at stake: it’s important for the U.S. to deter Russian aggression in Ukraine and around the world.

The American people heard directly from Ambassador Sondland that POTUS directed a scheme to bribe Ukraine there was a quid pro quo and everyone knew. Then we learned Ukraine knew too – as early as the 7/25 phone call.
